result.execSummary:
The defendant Kadjah S Newson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to pay restitution in the amount of $1,210.11 to McDonald's in Watertown

--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge

--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no presence at the McDonald's restaurant in Watertown

Arresting Agency: WTPD

from DOC requesting to cancel the 7-5-16 review because payment has been made
Probation review hearing on July 5, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with attached victim restitution request form(s)
with elements and criminal case settlement forms attached

Case called at 3:08pm [mo]
Defendant Kadjah S Newson in court with Attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
--ADA Beck submits Victim Impact Statement

The Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--to undergo any assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no presence at the McDonald's restaurant in Watertown
--to pay restitution in the amount of $1,210.11 to McDonald's in Watertown
--to pay 10% restitution processing fee
--to pay costs of $243  plus the $200 DNA surcharge


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess:3:18pm

Case called at 11:00 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Kadjah S Newson in court with Attorney Jennifer Lynn Weber. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Court requires a $1000 signature bond, with conditions: 
-Booking at JCSD
Recess: 11:04 am 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/8/15 at 10:40 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 7/30/15 at 3:00 pm - Send notices
Initial appearance on June 12, 2015 at 11:00 am.
The Court concludes the request is timely and in the proper form
